node.title: 'Our family is whole again': Cleo's parents speak for the first time since her rescue
node.alt: Experts say focus now on Cleo Smith's recovery after disappearance sparks nationwide search
node.description: Cleo Smith's parents speak out for the first time since the four-year-old was rescued, saying they are "so thankful that our little girl is back within our arms".
node.content: ["The family of Cleo Smith have spoken for the first time since the four-year-old was rescued, thanking the police and the community for their help in finding the little girl.", "In a short statement issued by police,\u00a0Cleo's parents Ellie Smith and Jake Gliddon said they wanted to take the opportunity to thank all those involved in her rescue from a Carnarvon house in the early hours of Wednesday, 18 days after she went missing while they were camping at the Blowholes.\u00a0", "\"In particular, we would like to thank WA Police, all those involved in the initial search, the Carnarvon community, local businesses and of course our family\u00a0and friends,\" the statement said.\u00a0", "\"We are humbled by the love and support that we have received from not only\u00a0our local community but the whole of Western Australia and across the\u00a0country.\u00a0", "\"We are so thankful that our little girl is back within our arms and our family is\u00a0whole again. As we try to get on with our lives, we ask that you respect our privacy.\""]
